sect2.title: What is &app;
sect2.para: &app; is an instant messaging program for the GNOME Desktop. It allows instant communication across a network using Jabber. &app; is written to be as simple to use as possible and to allow users of the GNOME Desktop to keep in touch with friends.

sect2.title: What is Instant Messaging
sect2.para: Instant messaging lets people send text messages to each other over a network, such as the Internet. They can add each other to a list, to see if their contacts are available.

sect2.title: What is Jabber
sect2.para: Jabber is an open instant messaging system which allows a group of interconnected servers to pass messages to one another in a similar fashion to email.

The Jabber protocol is an open, free and public standard, which was accepted by Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) under the name XMPP in 2004. It's decentralized and extensible with custom functionality.
More information on the Jabber protocol can be found on the Website of the Jabber Software Foundation and in the Wikipedia.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para:
Choose
Internet Gossip Instant Messenger .
To start &app; from a command line, type gossip and then press Return.

sect2.title: When You Start &app; the First Time
sect2.para: When you start &app; the first time, you will be prompted to configure a Jabber account.

listitem.para: Click Add, to add an account. Then complete the following information:
Give the account the Name you wish to be displayed.
Select Connect on Startup, if you wish to have the account automatically connect when &app; starts.
Select Use system proxy if you wish to connect using a system proxy.
Enter the Login ID.
Enter the Password.
Enter the Resource.
Enter the Server that you wish to connect to.
Enter the Port that you wish to use.
Select Use encryption (SSL) if your server supports encryption.
If this is a new Jabber account, then press Register. Otherwise, press Connect.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, contact list, status icon and status arrow button list. Menubar contains Chat, Edit and Help menus.

sect2.para: describes the components of a browser window.

entry.para: Contains menus that are used to perform tasks in &app;.
A drop-down list that allows the user to update their status.
Shows all available contacts and their associated statuses.

sect1.title: Basic Usage
sect1.para: You can use the &app; application to perform the following tasks:

sect2.title: Connect to a Jabber Server
sect2.para:
To connect to a Jabber server, choose
Chat Connect
from the Menubar.

sect2.title: Disconnect from a Jabber Server
sect2.para:
To disconnect from a Jabber server, choose
Chat Disconnect
from the Menubar.

sect2.title: Sending An Instant Message
sect2.para: You can send instant messages to a contact, in the following ways:

listitem.para: Double click on the contact's nickname in the Contact List, to open the chat window.

Choose
Ctrl N
Chat New Message
. A question dialog will be displayed, asking for the user ID or of the person you wish to send an instant message to. Type in the name or the contact ID and click Chat. You can also choose the name from the list.

tip.para: If you are online with more than one account, you can also choose from which of your accounts you want send the message.

listitem.para: Right click on &app;'s Notification Area icon, and select New Message. A question dialog will be displayed, asking for the user ID or of the person you wish to send an instant message to. Type in the name or the contact ID and click Chat. You can also choose the name from the list.

sect2.title: Receiving An Instant Message
sect2.para: When you receive an instant messages, &app; notifies you with a blinking balloon icon in the Notification Area and beside the nickname in the Contact List. You can read the message, in the following ways:

listitem.para: Double click on the contact's nickname in the Contact List, to open the chat window with the new message.
Click on the &app; icon in the Notification Area. A chat window with the new message will open.

sect2.title: Edit Account Personal Information
sect2.para:
To edit an accounts personal information, choose
Edit Personal Information
from the Menubar.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app;s Personal Details window, where the user can edit his personal information.

sect2.para: This will open the Personal Details dialog, which will allow you to provide the following information:

listitem.para: Select the Account you wish to edit from the drop-down list box.

note.para: This drop-down box will only be shown if you have more than one account set-up in &app;.

listitem.para: To add your name, edit the contents of the Name text box.
To add your nickname, edit the contents of the Nickname text box.
To add your e-mail address, edit the contents of the Email text box.
To add your web address, edit the contents of the Web site text box.
To add an avatar, click the Avatar image chooser button and select the image you wish to use.
To add a description about you, edit the contents of the Description text box.
To add your birthday, uncheck the Don't save checkbox in the Birthday section, and use the calendar to set your birthday.

sect2.para: After reviewing the information, click Save to publish your information.

sect2.title: Adding a Contact
sect2.para: If you add a contact to your contact list, you can see when this person is online. To add a contact, perform the following steps:

listitem.para:
Choose
Chat Add Contact
from the Menubar, to open the Add Contact dialog.
Select the Account you wish to add the contact to.

note.para: This drop-down box will only be shown if you have more than one account set-up in &app;.

listitem.para: Enter the Contact identity.

tip.para: The Contact identity looks like an email-address. Example: user@jabber.org

listitem.para: Enter the Alias, you wish to display in the Contact List.
Select the Group to associate with this contact from the drop-down list.
Review the information displayed and click Add.

note.para: A request will sent to the contact, asking to subscribe to their presence notifications. Until this request is approved, the user will be shown as "Offline" in your Contact List. In addition, everybody who wants to add you to their Contact List, needs your authorization.

sect2.title: Show Offline Contact's
sect2.para:
To show offline contact's in the Contact list, choose
Ctrl H
Chat Show Offline Contacts

sect2.title: Accessing a Contact's Information
sect2.para: A contact's information can be accessed with the following methods:

listitem.para: Right click a contact's alias in the Contact List and select Information.

With the contact selected in the Contact List, choose
Edit Contact Information

sect2.title: Editing a Contact
sect2.para: The Edit Contact dialog can be open with the following methods:

listitem.para: Right click a contact's alias in the Contact List and select Edit.

With the contact selected in the Contact List, choose
Edit Contact Edit

sect2.title: Removing a Contact
sect2.para: A contact can be removed with the following methods:

listitem.para: Right click a contact's alias in the Contact List and select Remove.

With the contact selected in the in the Contact list, choose
Edit Contact Remove

sect1.title: Using Online Status
sect1.para: You can use online status to show other users, if you are available for chat, busy or away. You can check the online status of your contacts in the contact list. In addition to your online status you can save a status message, e.g Out for shopping.

sect2.title: Different Online Status
sect2.para:
Gossip knows following online statuses:
Status Icon
Description
Shows a green circle.
Available
Shows a yellow circle with a sheet of paper.
Busy
Shows a red triangle.
Away
Shows a red triangle with a question mark.
Extended away
Shows a grey square.
Offline

sect2.title: Change Online Status
sect2.para: You can change your online status, in the following ways:

listitem.para: Click on the status button at the top of the contact list and choose one of the statuses.
Click with the right mouse button on &app;'s notification area icon and select in Status one of the status messages.

sect2.title: Automatic Online Status
sect2.para: If your computer is inactive for five minutes, &app; will switch your online status from Available to Away. If your computer remains inactive for 30 minutes, &app; will switch from Away to Extended away.
Once your computer becomes active again , &app; will switch after 15 seconds from Away or Extended away to Available. Also when you send a message, &app; switches back to Available.

sect2.title: Clean Saved Statuses
sect2.para:
You can delete all saved customized status messages, in the following ways:
Click on the status arrow button at the top of the contact list and choose Clear List.
All your saved status messages will irrevocable be deleted.
Click with the right mouse button on the &app;'s notification area icon and select in Status and choose Clear List.

sect1.title: Using Group Chats
sect1.para: Group chat can be used to have a conversation with more than one person.

sect2.title: Joining A New Group Chat Room
sect2.para:
To join a new Group Chat Room, choose
Room Join New from the MenuBar.
This will open the Join New dialog, in which the following information will need to be completed:

listitem.para: Select the Jabber account to use from the Account drop-down box.

note.para: This drop-down box will only be shown if you have more than one account set-up in &app;.

listitem.para: Enter the Server to connect to.
Enter the Room to join.
Enter your Nickname.

sect2.para: After completing the necessary information, click Join to enter the Chat Room.

sect2.title: Managing Favorite Group Chats
sect2.para:
To manage a users favorite group chats, choose
Room Manage Favorites... from the MenuBar.
This will open the Manage Favorite Rooms dialog, which will allow the user to edit their favorite chat rooms.

sect2.title: Invite A Contact To A Group Chat
sect2.para: To open the Invite dialog, which allows the user to invite contacts to a group chat. Perform one of the following methods:

listitem.para: Right click a contact's alias in the Contact List, and select Invite to Chat Room

With the contact selected in the in the Contact list, choose
Edit Contact Invite to Chat Room

sect1.title: Settings
sect1.para:
To configure &app;, choose
Edit Preferences . The Preferences dialog contains the following tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Select the Show avatars option, to enable avatar support in the contact list area.
Select Show compact contact list option, to not show the contact's presence status message in the Contact List.
Select the Show smileys as images option, to enable graphical images. This will replace text-smileys like ":)" by corresponding images.
Select the Open new chats in separate windows option, to open chats in separate windows. If you did not select this option, new chats will open in tabs in the last opened chat window.
Select the Play sound when messages arrive option to enable sounds.
Select the Enable sounds when busy option to get notified about new messages when busy.
Select the Enable sounds when away option to get notified about new messages when away.
Select Display notifications when contact come online to get visual cues when contacts come online.

note.para: These setting might not be available if spell checking capabilities were not compiled into &app;.

listitem.para: Select the languages you wish to enable for spell checking

tip.para: The list of languages only reflect the languages that have a dictionary installed.

listitem.para: Select Enable spell checking, if desired.
Select the desired Chat Theme from the drop-down list.
Select Use for chat rooms, if desired.
